required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Rivaroxaban in Sickle Cell Disease
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Factor Xa Inhibition, With Rivaroxaban, on the Pathology of Sickle Cell Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will consist of a Screening Phase, two Treatment Phases, a Wash-Out Phase, and a Follow-up Phase. The Screening Phase will occur within 28 days of randomization and will include informed consent, a physical examination, and complete medical history to include determination of sickle cell genotype and current medications. Clinical laboratory tests to be performed include: a Complete Blood Count (CBC) with differential and reticulocyte count; Prothrombin time(PT) / activated partial thromboplastin time (aPTT); and serum chemistries (BUN, creatinine, total and direct bilirubin, alanine aminotransferase (ALT), aspartate aminotransferase (AST), alkaline phosphatase, and LDH). A chest x-ray and MRI/MRA of the brain will also be done at Screening to rule out underlying disease.
If the patient is found through the screening process to be eligible, the 1st Treatment Phase begins. Baseline safety assessments and measurement of biomarkers are completed, then the subject is randomized to receive rivaroxaban or placebo. After 4 weeks of treatment, there is a 2-Week Wash-Out Phase. After the Wash-Out Phase, another set of baseline studies are performed and the 2nd Treatment Phase begins. For this Phase of the study, the subject "crosses over" to receive whatever treatment - rivaroxaban or placebo - that they did not receive in the 1st Treatment Phase. After taking the assigned study drug for 4 weeks, the 2nd Treatment Phase ends. The subject returns 2 weeks after the last dose of study treatment for the Follow-Up Phase, consisting of a single end-of-study visit during which safety assessments are repeated.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks in Soluble Vascular Cell Adhesion Molecule-1 (VCAM-1)
primary_outcome.description: Assay performed for soluble VCAM-1 using a commercially available enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks in Interleukin-6 (IL-6)
primary_outcome.description: Assay performed for IL-6 using a commercially available enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in the Plasma Marker of Inflammation IL-2
secondary_outcome.description: Interleukin-2 (IL-2) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in the Plasma Marker of Inflammation IL-8
secondary_outcome.description: Interleukin-8 (IL-8) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in Plasma Marker of Inflammation hsCRP
secondary_outcome.description: high sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in Plasma Marker of Inflammation MPO
secondary_outcome.description: myeloperoxidase (MPO) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in Plasma Marker of Inflammation TNF-a
secondary_outcome.description: tumor necrosis factor alpha (TNF-a) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in Plasma Marker of Inflammation sPLA2
secondary_outcome.description: secretory phospholipase A2 (sPLA2) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in Marker of Endothelial Cell (EC) Activation sICAM
secondary_outcome.description: levels of soluble intracellular adhesion molecule (sICAM) were measured using a commercially available ELISA

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in TH1
secondary_outcome.description: Microvascular blood flow was measured using laser doppler velocimetry (LDV) assessments of post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). This was accomplished using the Perimed PF5001 Velocitometer (Stockholm, Sweden). Variable measured: time to half before hyperemia (TH1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in TM
secondary_outcome.description: Microvascular blood flow was measured using laser doppler velocimetry (LDV) assessments of post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). This was accomplished using the Perimed PF5001 Velocitometer (Stockholm, Sweden). Variable measured: time to max (TM)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in AH
secondary_outcome.description: Microvascular blood flow was measured using laser doppler velocimetry (LDV) assessments of post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). This was accomplished using the Perimed PF5001 Velocitometer (Stockholm, Sweden). Variable measured: hyperemia area (AH)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Ratio From Baseline to Week 4 in AH/AO
secondary_outcome.description: Microvascular blood flow was measured using laser doppler velocimetry (LDV) assessments of post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). This was accomplished using the Perimed PF5001 Velocitometer (Stockholm, Sweden). Variables measured: hyperemia area (AH) and occlusion area (AO)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in PF
secondary_outcome.description: Microvascular blood flow was measured using laser doppler velocimetry (LDV) assessments of post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). This was accomplished using the Perimed PF5001 Velocitometer (Stockholm, Sweden). Variable measured: peak flow (PF)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in RF
secondary_outcome.description: Microvascular blood flow was measured using laser doppler velocimetry (LDV) assessments of post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). This was accomplished using the Perimed PF5001 Velocitometer (Stockholm, Sweden). Variable measured: rest flow (RF)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in TAT
secondary_outcome.description: Assay for thrombin antithrombin (TAT) complexes performed using commercially available enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in D-Dimer
secondary_outcome.description: Assay for D--dimer is performed using commercially available enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Rivaroxaban for 4 wks, Placebo for 4 wks
arm_group.description: Subject will receive rivaroxaban 20mg PO daily for 4 weeks and then matching placebo 1 PO daily for 4 weeks, with a 2-week wash out period in between the two treatment phases. Both of the two treatments will be in capsule form.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo for 4 wks, rivaroxaban for 4 wks
arm_group.description: Subject will receive placebo 1 PO daily for 4 weeks, then rivaroxaban 20mg PO daily for 4 weeks, with a 2-week wash out period in between the two treatment phases. Both of the two treatments will be in capsule form.

intervention.description: Subject will receive rivaroxaban 20mg PO daily for 4 weeks and then matching placebo 1 PO daily for 4 weeks, with a 2-week wash out period in between the two treatment phases. Both of the two treatments will be in capsule form OR Subject will receive placebo 1 PO daily for 4 weeks, then rivaroxaban 20mg PO daily for 4 weeks, with a 2-week wash out period in between the two treatment phases. Both of the two treatments will be in capsule form.
intervention.arm_group_label: Placebo for 4 wks, rivaroxaban for 4 wks
Rivaroxaban for 4 wks, Placebo for 4 wks

intervention.description: Subject will receive rivaroxaban 20mg PO daily for 4 weeks and then matching placebo 1 PO daily for 4 weeks, with a 2-week wash out period in between the two treatment phases. Both of the two treatments will be in capsule form OR Subject will receive placebo 1 PO daily for 4 weeks, then rivaroxaban 20mg PO daily for 4 weeks, with a 2-week wash out period in between the two treatment phases. Both of the two treatments will be in capsule form.
intervention.arm_group_label: Placebo for 4 wks, rivaroxaban for 4 wks
Rivaroxaban for 4 wks, Placebo for 4 wks

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: University of North Carolina - Chapel Hill

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 15 subjects signed informed consent and were successfully screened. One subject withdrew during Baseline and prior to the first intervention and data from this individual are included in the baseline characteristics. One subject entered the second intervention period but was lost to follow up before receiving the intervention.

group.title: Rivaroxaban, Then Placebo
group.description: Participants first received Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet once daily for 4 weeks. After a washout period of 2 weeks, they then received placebo (matching Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet) once daily for 4 weeks. Rivaroxaban: 20 mg tablet by mouth daily for 4 weeks Placebo: Matching placebo tablet by mouth daily for 4 weeks

group.title: Placebo, Then Rivaroxaban
group.description: Participants first received placebo (matching Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet) once daily for 4 weeks. After a washout period of 2 weeks, they then received Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet once daily for 4 weeks. Rivaroxaban: 20 mg tablet by mouth daily for 4 weeks Placebo: Matching placebo tablet by mouth daily for 4 weeks

baseline.population: All participants who had a screening visit

group.title: Study Participants
group.description: Participants who had a screening visit

measure.title: Age, Customized
Sex: Female, Male
Race (NIH/OMB)

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Weight
Height
measure.population: Only measured on the participants who received study medication

measure.title: White Blood Cell (WBC) count
Genotype - Hemoglobin SS (HbSS)
Platelet count
Serum Creatinine
Prothrombin Time (PT)
measure.description: A test that measures how quickly blood clots
measure.population: Only measured on the participants who received study medication

measure.title: International Normalized Ratio (INR)
measure.description: The ratio of a patient's prothrombin time to a normal (control) sample
measure.population: Only measured on the participants who received study medication

measure.title: Partial Thromboplastin Time (PTT)
measure.description: Measures the time it takes for a blood clot to form
measure.population: Only measured on the participants who received study medication

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to 4 Weeks in Soluble Vascular Cell Adhesion Molecule-1 (VCAM-1)
outcome.description: Assay performed for soluble VCAM-1 using a commercially available enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).
outcome.population: Data reported only for those participants who completed both interventions.

group.description: Participants who received placebo tablet (matching Rivaroxaban 20 mg) in either the first or the second half of the study

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in the Plasma Marker of Inflammation IL-2
outcome.description: Interleukin-2 (IL-2) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility
outcome.population: Data analyzed for the 13 participants completing both interventions but results for 6 participants in each group fell outside the standard curve and could not be extrapolated.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in Plasma Marker of Inflammation hsCRP
outcome.description: high sensitivity C-reactive protein (hsCRP) was measured using Luminex MAP technology at the UNC core facility.
outcome.population: Biomarker evaluations were limited to IL-2 and IL-8 as those were thought more likely to reflect inflammation activation based on experience in recent studies.

group.title: Rivaroxaban, Then Placebo
group.description: Participants first received Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet once daily for 4 weeks. After a washout period of 2 weeks, they then received placebo (matching Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet) once daily for 4 weeks. Rivaroxaban: 20 mg tablet by mouth daily for 4 weeks Placebo: Matching placebo tablet by mouth daily for 4 weeks

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 4 in TH1
outcome.description: Microvascular blood flow was measured using laser doppler velocimetry (LDV) assessments of post-occlusive reactive hyperemia (PORH). This was accomplished using the Perimed PF5001 Velocitometer (Stockholm, Sweden). Variable measured: time to half before hyperemia (TH1)
outcome.population: All participants randomized to each treatment were analyzed.

group.title: Rivaroxaban
group.description: Participants who received Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet in either the first or the second half of the study

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who received placebo tablet (matching Rivaroxaban 20 mg) in either the first or the second half of the study

measure.population: All participants randomized to each treatment were analyzed.

analysis.method_desc: Student t-test subsequently followed by crossover ANOVA model testing carry-over effect and treatment effect

reported_events.time_frame: Data collected from date of informed consent to end of study visit, approximately 3 months
reported_events.desc: The safety analysis population includes all participants exposed to any study intervention evaluated in this study.

group.title: Rivaroxaban
group.description: Participants who received Rivaroxaban 20 mg tablet in either the first or the second half of the study

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Participants who received placebo tablet (matching Rivaroxaban 20 mg) in either the first or the second half of the study

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: University of Tennessee Center for the Heath Sciences
